Package lib.homies.framework.config

Interface ConfigManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
SpigotConfigManager
public interface ConfigManager
A platform-agnostic interface for managing configuration files. All operations are performed asynchronously to prevent blocking the main server thread.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> CompletableFuture<T>
    loadConfig(PluginContext pluginContext, Class<T> configClass)
    Asynchronously loads a configuration class, creating the file with default values if it doesn't exist.
    CompletableFuture<Void>
    saveConfig(PluginContext pluginContext, Object configInstance)
    Asynchronously saves the current state of a configuration object back to its file.

  • Method Details

    • loadConfig

      <T> CompletableFuture<T> loadConfig(PluginContext pluginContext, Class<T> configClass)
      Asynchronously loads a configuration class, creating the file with default values if it doesn't exist. The configuration class must be a POJO annotated with ConfigFile. Fields within the class intended for configuration should be annotated with ConfigKey.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the configuration class.
      Parameters:
      pluginContext - The context of the plugin calling this method, used to access its data folder and resources.
      configClass - The class representing the configuration.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will complete with an instance of the configuration class.

    • saveConfig

      CompletableFuture<Void> saveConfig(PluginContext pluginContext, Object configInstance)
      Asynchronously saves the current state of a configuration object back to its file. The configuration object must be an instance of a class annotated with ConfigFile.
      Parameters:
      pluginContext - The context of the plugin calling this method, used to access its data folder.
      configInstance - The configuration object to save.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will complete when the save operation is finished.
